Package fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing

Class AbstractIndexingTree<T,​N extends IndexingNode<T,​N>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.AbstractIndexingTree<T,​N>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of objects indexed
    N - the type of node used to build this tree
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndexingTree<T,​N>, Dimensioned, fr.ens.biologie.generic.Sizeable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LimitedPrecisionIndexingTree, RegionIndexingTree
    public abstract class AbstractIndexingTree<T,​N extends IndexingNode<T,​N>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements IndexingTree<T,​N>

    An abstract ancestor for 'generalised QuadTrees'. By generalised we mean indexing trees of any dimension (strictly speaking, k-d trees), e.g. a binary tree for dim=1, a quadtree for dim=2, and an octree for dim=3.

    The implementation proposed is generic, i.e. the tree dimension is inferred from the dimension of the Points used to build the tree.

    Implementations are provided for point-based and region-based trees.

    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux - 29-08-2018
